episodeTitle: The First Obstacle? Giant Whale Laboon Appears!
episodeTitleJapanese: 最初の砦?巨大鯨ラブーン現る
episodeTitleRomanized: Saisho no Toride? Kyodai Kujira Rabūn Arawaru
description: Upon entering the Grand Line with a broken helm, the Straw Hat Pirates are swallowed by Laboon, a massive Island Whale. Inside the whale, they meet Crocus, the lighthouse keeper who cares for Laboon. They learn that Laboon has been waiting 50 years for the Rumbar Pirates to return, continuously ramming his head against the Red Line in pain and longing.

events.title: Straw Hats Enter the Grand Line
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully navigate down Reverse Mountain and enter the Grand Line, one of the most dangerous seas in the world. Their journey down the mountain is perilous with their helm broken, setting up the challenges ahead.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the crew's true adventure in the Grand Line, a major turning point in the series. This is the moment the crew officially enters the most dangerous ocean where the One Piece is hidden.

quotes.text: This is it! We're finally entering the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: As the crew rides down Reverse Mountain

events.title: Laboon First Appears
events.description: A massive Island Whale named Laboon appears at the end of Reverse Mountain, blocking the Straw Hats' path. At first appearing as a mountain through the fog, Laboon's true size becomes apparent as the crew realizes they're heading straight for collision with a living creature.
events.significance: Introduces Laboon, one of the most emotionally significant characters in One Piece. His story connects to Brook and the Rumbar Pirates, establishing a thread that spans hundreds of episodes. Laboon represents the themes of loyalty, friendship, and keeping promises.

quotes.text: That's not a mountain... it's a whale!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: When the fog clears and they see Laboon's true form

events.title: Going Merry Crashes into Laboon
events.description: Unable to steer properly with their broken helm, the Going Merry crashes directly into Laboon, breaking the ship's mast and sheep figurehead. The impact seems insignificant to the massive whale but causes significant damage to the ship.
events.significance: Demonstrates the scale difference between the crew and the Grand Line's dangers. The destruction of the Going Merry's figurehead becomes important later when Luffy fights Laboon.

events.title: Straw Hats Swallowed by Laboon
events.description: Laboon opens his mouth and swallows the Going Merry whole. The crew finds themselves inside the whale's stomach, which contains an unexpected ocean-like environment with sky, clouds, and even an island.
events.significance: Creates the bizarre setting for meeting Crocus and establishes the unique nature of Laboon's internal modifications. This surreal moment showcases the strange and wonderful aspects of the Grand Line.

quotes.text: We're inside the whale?! How can there be sky and an island inside a whale?!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Discovering the bizarre interior of Laboon

events.title: Luffy Gets Separated from the Crew
events.description: During the chaos of being swallowed, Luffy becomes separated from the rest of the Straw Hat crew. While the others explore Laboon's interior together, Luffy ends up elsewhere inside the massive whale.
events.significance: Sets up Luffy's independent encounter with Laboon that becomes crucial in the next episode. This separation allows for parallel storytelling as the crew meets Crocus.

events.title: Crocus Debuts
events.description: The Straw Hats encounter a mysterious old man relaxing in a beach chair inside Laboon, reading a newspaper. He casually introduces himself as Crocus, the keeper of the Twin Cape lighthouse, completely unfazed by their presence inside the whale.
events.significance: Introduces Crocus, who later reveals his connection to Gol D. Roger's crew. His calm demeanor and unusual living situation immediately establish him as an eccentric but important character. His role as Laboon's caretaker sets up the emotional backstory to come.

quotes.text: I'm Crocus, keeper of the Twin Cape lighthouse. I'm 71 years old, Gemini, blood type AB.
quotes.speaker: Crocus
quotes.context: His casual self-introduction inside the whale

events.title: Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday Debut
events.description: Two mysterious figures, Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday, appear inside Laboon. They reveal their intention to kill the whale and bring its meat back to Whisky Peak as food for their town, unaware of Laboon's significance.
events.significance: Introduces the first Baroque Works agents the crew encounters, beginning the Baroque Works saga. Miss Wednesday is later revealed to be Princess Nefertari Vivi, making this debut extremely important to the entire Arabasta arc.

quotes.text: We're going to kill this whale and take its meat back to Whisky Peak!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 9
quotes.context: Declaring their intentions to Crocus and the Straw Hats

events.title: Crocus Reveals Laboon's Story
events.description: Crocus explains Laboon's tragic history. Fifty years ago, Laboon befriended a pirate crew (the Rumbar Pirates) who promised to return after sailing the Grand Line. Laboon has been waiting ever since, continuously ramming his head against the Red Line in an attempt to reunite with his friends, not knowing they are long gone.
events.significance: One of the most emotionally powerful backstories in One Piece. Establishes the theme of waiting and loyalty that becomes central to Brook's character arc. This revelation makes Laboon's pain understandable and sets up the promise Luffy will make. The story foreshadows Brook's arrival 300+ episodes later.

quotes.text: This whale has been waiting for a certain group of pirates for 50 years. Laboon refuses to believe his friends are gone and keeps bashing his head against the Red Line, trying to break through to find them.
quotes.speaker: Crocus

events.title: Island Whales Explained
events.description: Crocus explains that Laboon is an Island Whale, the largest species of whale in the world, native to the West Blue. Their massive size and unique characteristics make them legendary creatures in the One Piece world.
events.significance: Provides world-building information about the different seas and their unique creatures. Establishes the scale and diversity of the One Piece world's ecosystem.

quotes.text: Laboon is an Island Whale, which inhabit the West Blue. They are the largest species of whale in the world.
quotes.speaker: Crocus

events.title: Crocus Breaks the Fourth Wall
events.description: Crocus makes a comment acknowledging that his introduction with personal details was 'a good running gag,' directly breaking the fourth wall and referencing the anime medium itself.
events.significance: A rare fourth-wall break in One Piece, adding humor and showcasing the series' willingness to be self-aware. This became a memorable moment for fans of the episode.

quotes.text: I'm Crocus, keeper of the Twin Cape lighthouse. I'm 71 years old, Gemini, blood type AB.
quotes.speaker: Crocus

quotes.text: This whale has been waiting for a certain group of pirates for 50 years.
quotes.speaker: Crocus

quotes.text: That's not a mountain... it's a whale!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

themes.description: Laboon's 50-year wait for the Rumbar Pirates demonstrates unwavering loyalty and the pain of broken promises. This theme of keeping promises and honoring bonds becomes central to the series.
themes.symbolism: Laboon ramming his head against the Red Line symbolizes the futile but persistent hope of reunion and the self-destructive nature of grief.

themes.description: The episode marks the crew's official entry into the Grand Line, representing a transition from the relatively safe East Blue to a world of greater danger and wonder.
themes.symbolism: Laboon serves as the literal first obstacle in the Grand Line, symbolizing the challenges and emotional depths the crew will face.

themes.description: The bond between Laboon and the Rumbar Pirates transcends time, showing how true friendship endures even across decades of separation.
themes.symbolism: The island inside Laboon represents Crocus's attempt to create a world for Laboon while he waits, showing care and compassion.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a seemingly aggressive whale, Laboon is revealed to be a loyal friend suffering from grief and loneliness.
keyActions: Appears blocking the Grand Line entrance
Rams his head against the Red Line

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as an eccentric old man living inside a whale, Crocus is revealed to be a compassionate doctor caring for Laboon's physical and emotional wounds.
keyActions: Casually greets the Straw Hats inside Laboon
Reveals his role as lighthouse keeper and doctor
quotes: I'm Crocus, keeper of the Twin Cape lighthouse. I'm 71 years old, Gemini, blood type AB.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the interior scenes of Laboon to show more of the strange island environment, while the manga moves through this more quickly.

trivia.fact: Episode 62 marked the beginning of Season 2 of the One Piece anime, which introduced a new opening theme 'Believe' by Folder5.
Laboon's story is one of the longest-running plot threads in One Piece, with the setup in Episode 62 having its payoff over 300 episodes later when Brook joins the crew.
Crocus's fourth-wall break ('That's a good running gag!') is one of the few times in the anime where a character directly acknowledges the medium.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 13.7% in Japan, ranking 6th for the week.
In the 4Kids English dub, episodes 61-64 were heavily edited and combined into a single episode titled 'Fantastic Voyage'.
